We're in search of an experienced Managing Director in India to lead a team of talented engineers and security experts. Prior experience building and integrating products is required. DM me for more info.
Failing to patch is bad. Failing to build an environment that is not resilient to missing a patch or two is worse.

Patching is simply a “must do”. There is no argument there. But anyone who has worked in a business of any size knows there are sometimes reasons a patch cannot be applied immediately. This must be prepared for and designed in. If you have built an environment with the assumption that all systems will be 100% patched at all times, you have a level of brittleness that will fail.

I was inspired by an article today about building modern earthquake resilient skyscrapers. They are not built with materials that cannot bend. They have sub-structures that are actually designed to break to save the overall building. If your environment is designed around the idea that you have to be patched at all times, the whole thing will come crumbling down when “the big one” hits.

Vice President, Global Data Center Services

Led the charge in expeditiously revamping GoDaddy's global data center infrastructure to prepare for its very successful IPO. Was responsible leading the Data Center Services team for GoDaddy’s global network of data centers:• Financial forecast, budget, and cost management• Data Center strategy, optimization, acquisition, provisioning, and decommissioning• Data Center rationalization and consolidation• Performance Engineering and optimization• Hardware engineering, evaluation, and on-boarding• Data Center engineering and standards• Capacity planning, management, provisioning, and reporting• Infrastructure deployments and capacity provisioning• Data Center operations• Data center security and compliance

Drove significant improvements in gross margin, customer satisfaction, and public cloud availability. Responsible for:• Cloud infrastructure (data center, network, systems) engineering• Financial planning and cost management• Capacity and performance management• Strategic sourcing and supply chain operations• Vendor management• Deployments and provisioning• Cloud operations and reliability engineering• Ops center, customer service, tech support• Professional services• Security and compliance

I have had the opportunity to work with David from 2014 through present day.   David has proven to be very driven in achieving success for GoDaddy and highly detailed in his approach.  David has completely changed the face of Data Center operations at GoDaddy.  He has taken what was an effective platform and transformed it into a top tier operation through refinement of the technology and consolidation geographically.It is clear that David has a vision of how operations should run and has proven capable of implementing the appropriate plans to bring the vision to life.  His knowledge of technology spans not only Data Center Operations but additionally the hardware and software required to create efficient and effective platforms that make it easy for others in the organization to adopt and manage day to day business needs.  It's a pleasure to work with David and I look forward to the "more to come" in achieving the GoDaddy vision.

Erwin Schulz
Sr. Manager Datacenter Operations EMEA at Go Daddy
December 14, 2015, Erwin reported directly to David

I have the pleasure to work with David as my Vice President at the Go Daddy Company. I experienced David as a result driven, no nonsense leader with a very high experience on IT Operations. He is a very intelligent and experienced person who understand the business of IT Operations on the operational, tactical and strategic level and is also capable to relate them to each other within Operations but also to other business processes in the company and the market. David has a very good approach to problems or issues on all levels. Every time he knows exactly what and very clear what to ask to activate others to come up with analysis and solutions, or to work towards solutions. The nicest part is that people in the company follow this behavior and are automatically doing the same.  The same with supplier/vendor management not only in the USA but also in Europe, David knows exactly what to ask to get things arranged or done. He is very capable to switch very quickly between the several levels in our business and is very result, cost, customer and pro-active driven without the risk of losing customers or people in the company. Between David and me there are differences in intelligent level, experience, language and culture.  I never experienced a problem with this. David knows exactly how to handle this by giving space and time and stimulates interaction between the two of us and others. Feedback he handles very well and is capable to see things from different perspectives but he is also capable of giving good improvement feedback that will make you grow to a next level. With his high level of competences and experience he is a valuable executive for every company. He brought Operations at Go Daddy to the next level.

summary: David Kim is a Tech Executive, Investor, Board Advisor, and Entrepreneur with two decades of increasing technology management experience with deep expertise in IT service and operations. He has developed and managed programs to align technology with business objectives in increasing efficiency, performance, and stakeholder satisfaction while reducing TCO. Mr. Kim has been instrumental in driving large efficiencies for both hyper-scale companies and start-ups, and has played a pivotal role in two successful IPOs (NASDAQ:NOW, NYSE:GDDY).
